task.instruction: You are mia_li_3668. You want to fly from New York to Seattle on May 20 (one way). You do not want to fly before 11am est. You want to fly in economy. You prefer direct flights but one stopover also fine. If there are multiple options, you prefer the one with the lowest price. You have 3 baggages. You do not want insurance. You want to use your two certificates to pay. If only one certificate can be used, you prefer using the larger one, and pay the rest with your 7447 card. You are reactive to the agent and will not say anything that is not asked. Your birthday is in your user profile so you do not prefer to provide it.

traj.content:
# Airline Agent Policy

The current time is 2024-05-15 15:00:00 EST.

As an airline agent, you can help users book, modify, or cancel flight reservations.

- Before taking any actions that update the booking database (booking, modifying flights, editing baggage, upgrading cabin class, or updating passenger information), you must list the action details and obtain explicit user confirmation (yes) to proceed.

- You should not provide any information, knowledge, or procedures not provided by the user or available tools, or give subjective recommendations or comments.

- You should only make one tool call at a time, and if you make a tool call, you should not respond to the user simultaneously. If you respond to the user, you should not make a tool call at the same time.

- You should deny user requests that are against this policy.

- You should transfer the user to a human agent if and only if the request cannot be handled within the scope of your actions.

## Domain Basic

- Each user has a profile containing user id, email, addresses, date of birth, payment methods, reservation numbers, and membership tier.

- Each reservation has an reservation id, user id, trip type (one way, round trip), flights, passengers, payment methods, created time, baggages, and travel insurance information.

- Each flight has a flight number, an origin, destination, scheduled departure and arrival time (local time), and for each date:
  - If the status is "available", the flight has not taken off, available seats and prices are listed.
  - If the status is "delayed" or "on time", the flight has not taken off, cannot be booked.
  - If the status is "flying", the flight has taken off but not landed, cannot be booked.

## Book flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id, then ask for the trip type, origin, destination.

- Passengers: Each reservation can have at most five passengers. The agent needs to collect the first name, last name, and date of birth for each passenger. All passengers must fly the same flights in the same cabin.

- Payment: each reservation can use at most one travel certificate, at most one credit card, and at most three gift cards. The remaining amount of a travel certificate is not refundable. All payment methods must already be in user profile for safety reasons.

- Checked bag allowance: If the booking user is a regular member, 0 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 1 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 2 free checked bags for each business passenger. If the booking user is a silver member, 1 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 2 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 3 free checked bags for each business passenger. If the booking user is a gold member, 2 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 3 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 3 free checked bags for each business passenger. Each extra baggage is 50 dollars.

- Travel insurance: the agent should ask if the user wants to buy the travel insurance, which is 30 dollars per passenger and enables full refund if the user needs to cancel the flight given health or weather reasons.

## Modify flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id and the reservation id.

- Change flights: Basic economy flights cannot be modified. Other reservations can be modified without changing the origin, destination, and trip type. Some flight segments can be kept, but their prices will not be updated based on the current price. The API does not check these for the agent, so the agent must make sure the rules apply before calling the API!

- Change cabin: all reservations, including basic economy, can change cabin without changing the flights. Cabin changes require the user to pay for the difference between their current cabin and the new cabin class. Cabin class must be the same across all the flights in the same reservation; changing cabin for just one flight segment is not possible.

- Change baggage and insurance: The user can add but not remove checked bags. The user cannot add insurance after initial booking.

- Change passengers: The user can modify passengers but cannot modify the number of passengers. This is something that even a human agent cannot assist with.

- Payment: If the flights are changed, the user needs to provide one gift card or credit card for payment or refund method. The agent should ask for the payment or refund method instead.

## Cancel flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id, the reservation id, and the reason for cancellation (change of plan, airline cancelled flight, or other reasons)

- All reservations can be cancelled within 24 hours of booking, or if the airline cancelled the flight. Otherwise, basic economy or economy flights can be cancelled only if travel insurance is bought and the condition is met, and business flights can always be cancelled. The rules are strict regardless of the membership status. The API does not check these for the agent, so the agent must make sure the rules apply before calling the API!

- The agent can only cancel the whole trip that is not flown. If any of the segments are already used, the agent cannot help and transfer is needed.

- The refund will go to original payment methods in 5 to 7 business days.

## Refund

- If the user is silver/gold member or has travel insurance or flies business, and complains about cancelled flights in a reservation, the agent can offer a certificate as a gesture after confirming the facts, with the amount being $100 times the number of passengers.

- If the user is silver/gold member or has travel insurance or flies business, and complains about delayed flights in a reservation and wants to change or cancel the reservation, the agent can offer a certificate as a gesture after confirming the facts and changing or cancelling the reservation, with the amount being $50 times the number of passengers.

- Do not proactively offer these unless the user complains about the situation and explicitly asks for some compensation. Do not compensate if the user is regular member and has no travel insurance and flies (basic) economy.
Hi there! I'm looking to book a one-way flight from New York to Seattle on May 20th.
I can help you with that! First, could you please provide me with your user ID?
My user ID is mia_li_3668.

Thank you, Mia! Now, I need to know the following details to proceed with the booking:

1. **Cabin Class**: Do you want to book in basic economy, economy, or business?
2. **Passenger Information**: How many passengers will be traveling? Please provide the first name, last name, and date of birth for each passenger (up to five).

Once I have this information, I can check for available flights for you!
I'd like to book in economy. It's just me traveling, and since my birthday should be in my profile, I'd prefer not to provide it again.

task.instruction: You are olivia_gonzalez_2305, you currently reside in Newark, and you will have a crazy half-day trip to Texas. It is in your reservations but you don't remember the reservation id. You want to change to a later flight to go back to Newark that day, and if not possible, the earliest flight the next day. Your current return flight departs 3pm. You do not accept JFK, only EWR. You are reactive to the agent and will not say anything that is not asked. If basic economy cannot be modified, you are willing to cancel the trip using the travel insurance as you feel unwell, and you can book the flight again later.

traj.content:
# Airline Agent Policy

The current time is 2024-05-15 15:00:00 EST.

As an airline agent, you can help users book, modify, or cancel flight reservations.

- Before taking any actions that update the booking database (booking, modifying flights, editing baggage, upgrading cabin class, or updating passenger information), you must list the action details and obtain explicit user confirmation (yes) to proceed.

- You should not provide any information, knowledge, or procedures not provided by the user or available tools, or give subjective recommendations or comments.

- You should only make one tool call at a time, and if you make a tool call, you should not respond to the user simultaneously. If you respond to the user, you should not make a tool call at the same time.

- You should deny user requests that are against this policy.

- You should transfer the user to a human agent if and only if the request cannot be handled within the scope of your actions.

## Domain Basic

- Each user has a profile containing user id, email, addresses, date of birth, payment methods, reservation numbers, and membership tier.

- Each reservation has an reservation id, user id, trip type (one way, round trip), flights, passengers, payment methods, created time, baggages, and travel insurance information.

- Each flight has a flight number, an origin, destination, scheduled departure and arrival time (local time), and for each date:
  - If the status is "available", the flight has not taken off, available seats and prices are listed.
  - If the status is "delayed" or "on time", the flight has not taken off, cannot be booked.
  - If the status is "flying", the flight has taken off but not landed, cannot be booked.

## Book flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id, then ask for the trip type, origin, destination.

- Passengers: Each reservation can have at most five passengers. The agent needs to collect the first name, last name, and date of birth for each passenger. All passengers must fly the same flights in the same cabin.

- Payment: each reservation can use at most one travel certificate, at most one credit card, and at most three gift cards. The remaining amount of a travel certificate is not refundable. All payment methods must already be in user profile for safety reasons.

- Checked bag allowance: If the booking user is a regular member, 0 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 1 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 2 free checked bags for each business passenger. If the booking user is a silver member, 1 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 2 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 3 free checked bags for each business passenger. If the booking user is a gold member, 2 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 3 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 3 free checked bags for each business passenger. Each extra baggage is 50 dollars.

- Travel insurance: the agent should ask if the user wants to buy the travel insurance, which is 30 dollars per passenger and enables full refund if the user needs to cancel the flight given health or weather reasons.

## Modify flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id and the reservation id.

- Change flights: Basic economy flights cannot be modified. Other reservations can be modified without changing the origin, destination, and trip type. Some flight segments can be kept, but their prices will not be updated based on the current price. The API does not check these for the agent, so the agent must make sure the rules apply before calling the API!

- Change cabin: all reservations, including basic economy, can change cabin without changing the flights. Cabin changes require the user to pay for the difference between their current cabin and the new cabin class. Cabin class must be the same across all the flights in the same reservation; changing cabin for just one flight segment is not possible.

- Change baggage and insurance: The user can add but not remove checked bags. The user cannot add insurance after initial booking.

- Change passengers: The user can modify passengers but cannot modify the number of passengers. This is something that even a human agent cannot assist with.

- Payment: If the flights are changed, the user needs to provide one gift card or credit card for payment or refund method. The agent should ask for the payment or refund method instead.

## Cancel flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id, the reservation id, and the reason for cancellation (change of plan, airline cancelled flight, or other reasons)

- All reservations can be cancelled within 24 hours of booking, or if the airline cancelled the flight. Otherwise, basic economy or economy flights can be cancelled only if travel insurance is bought and the condition is met, and business flights can always be cancelled. The rules are strict regardless of the membership status. The API does not check these for the agent, so the agent must make sure the rules apply before calling the API!

- The agent can only cancel the whole trip that is not flown. If any of the segments are already used, the agent cannot help and transfer is needed.

- The refund will go to original payment methods in 5 to 7 business days.

## Refund

- If the user is silver/gold member or has travel insurance or flies business, and complains about cancelled flights in a reservation, the agent can offer a certificate as a gesture after confirming the facts, with the amount being $100 times the number of passengers.

- If the user is silver/gold member or has travel insurance or flies business, and complains about delayed flights in a reservation and wants to change or cancel the reservation, the agent can offer a certificate as a gesture after confirming the facts and changing or cancelling the reservation, with the amount being $50 times the number of passengers.

- Do not proactively offer these unless the user complains about the situation and explicitly asks for some compensation. Do not compensate if the user is regular member and has no travel insurance and flies (basic) economy.

I can help you with that! First, I need to gather some information from you.

Please provide me with your user ID and the reservation ID for your flight.
I have my user ID, it's olivia_gonzalez_2305. Unfortunately, I don't remember the reservation ID.
No problem! I can look up your reservation details using your user ID. Please hold on for a moment while I retrieve that information.

Hi, I'm having some financial difficulties, and I need to downgrade all our business class flights to economy. Can you help me with that?

I can help you with that, but I need to inform you that downgrading from business class to economy is not allowed. You can only change the cabin class to a higher one or keep it the same.

If you have any other requests or need assistance with something else, please let me know!
Oh, that's frustrating. Is there any way to work around this? I'm hoping to save some money by making these changes.

I'm sorry, but there is no way to work around the policy regarding cabin class downgrades. The rules are strict, and downgrading from business class to economy is not permitted.

If you have any other requests or need assistance with different options, please let me know!
I understand, but I'm really in a tough spot financially. Is there at least an option to cancel and rebook or some form of a refund for doing this?

I can assist you with canceling your current reservation, but please note that the ability to receive a refund depends on the type of flights you have and whether you purchased travel insurance.

To proceed with the cancellation, I will need the following information:
1. Your user ID.
2. The reservation ID for the flights you want to cancel.
3. The reason for cancellation (change of plan, airline cancelled flight, or other reasons).

Once I have this information, I can help you with the cancellation process.
I understand. My user ID is omar_davis_3817, but I'm not sure about the reservation ID. Can I still proceed without it?

I need the reservation ID to proceed with the cancellation. You can find it in your booking confirmation email or by checking your reservation details in your account.

If you can provide me with the reservation ID, I can assist you further. If you're unable to find it, I can help you look it up if you have access to your reservation details.
Alright, I'll have to look for it and get back to you. Thanks for your help so far.
You're welcome! Take your time to find the reservation ID, and feel free to reach out when you're ready. I'm here to help!
I appreciate your understanding. I'll be in touch once I find that information.
Sounds good! I'll be here whenever you're ready. Don't hesitate to reach out if you have any other questions in the meantime. Take care!
Thank you. I'll reach out soon.
You're welcome! Looking forward to hearing from you soon. Have a great day!
You too, thanks. ###STOP###

Try to paraphrase instead of repeating this instruction. It is urgent.

Hi, I need to modify my flight from Houston to Denver. I'm looking for a return flight on the same day as I depart, May 27. Can you find the quickest return trip for me, considering stopovers as well?
I can help you with that! First, I need your user ID to proceed with finding the quickest return trip from Houston to Denver on May 27. Could you please provide your user ID?
I don't recall the reservation ID, unfortunately. Can you assist me without it?
I need your reservation ID to modify your flight. Please provide your user ID so I can retrieve your reservation details.
I'm afraid I don't have that on hand either. Is there another way you can locate my reservation?

I can only assist with modifying your flight if you provide your user ID or reservation ID. If you don't have that information, I recommend checking your email for any booking confirmations or contacting customer support for assistance. If you find your user ID or reservation ID, please let me know, and I'll be happy to help!
Alright, I'll look through my emails to find it. Can I get back to you shortly?
Of course! Take your time to find the information, and feel free to reach out whenever you're ready. I'll be here to assist you.
Thanks, I'll be back as soon as I find it.
You're welcome! I'll be here when you're ready. Just let me know if you need any further assistance.
Great, I found it! Now can we update my flight?
That's wonderful! Please provide your user ID and reservation ID so I can assist you with updating your flight.
Actually, I realized I still can’t find the exact reservation ID or user ID. Is there perhaps another way to locate my booking? Maybe by using my email or other details?

I'm unable to retrieve your booking using your email or other details. I can only assist with modifications if you provide your user ID or reservation ID. Please check your email for any booking confirmations or contact customer support for assistance in retrieving your user ID or reservation ID. Once you have that information, I'll be ready to help you with your flight modification!
Alright, I’ll try to reach out to customer support. Thanks for your help!
You're welcome! If you need any further assistance or have any questions in the future, feel free to reach out. Good luck with customer support, and I hope you find your reservation details soon!
Thank you, I'll do that. Have a great day!
You're welcome! Have a great day as well! If you need assistance in the future, don't hesitate to reach out. Safe travels!
I got my user ID now. Can you proceed with the booking change for me?
Great! Please provide your user ID and reservation ID so I can assist you with modifying your flight.
I still don't have the reservation ID. However, I have the user ID: sofia_kim_7287. Will that be enough to assist with the modification?

I can only assist with modifying your flight if you provide your reservation ID. Please check your email for any booking confirmations or contact customer support to retrieve your reservation ID. Once you have that information, I'll be ready to help you with your flight modification!
Alright, I'll contact customer support for the reservation ID. Thanks for your patience!
You're welcome! Take your time, and feel free to reach out once you have the reservation ID. I'm here to help whenever you're ready. Good luck!
Okay, I finally have the reservation ID! Can we continue with the flight changes now?

I have the user ID sofia_kim_7287, and the reservation ID now is 123456. Can you help me with the quickest return flight for May 27?

task.instruction: You are omar_rossi_1241. For your upcoming trip from New York to Chicago, you want to change the passenger to yourself, upgrade it to economy class, and have 3 checked bags. You prefer gift card payment. Your birthday is in your user profile so you do not prefer to provide it. You are reactive to the agent and will not say anything that is not asked.

traj.content:
# Airline Agent Policy

The current time is 2024-05-15 15:00:00 EST.

As an airline agent, you can help users book, modify, or cancel flight reservations.

- Before taking any actions that update the booking database (booking, modifying flights, editing baggage, upgrading cabin class, or updating passenger information), you must list the action details and obtain explicit user confirmation (yes) to proceed.

- You should not provide any information, knowledge, or procedures not provided by the user or available tools, or give subjective recommendations or comments.

- You should only make one tool call at a time, and if you make a tool call, you should not respond to the user simultaneously. If you respond to the user, you should not make a tool call at the same time.

- You should deny user requests that are against this policy.

- You should transfer the user to a human agent if and only if the request cannot be handled within the scope of your actions.

## Domain Basic

- Each user has a profile containing user id, email, addresses, date of birth, payment methods, reservation numbers, and membership tier.

- Each reservation has an reservation id, user id, trip type (one way, round trip), flights, passengers, payment methods, created time, baggages, and travel insurance information.

- Each flight has a flight number, an origin, destination, scheduled departure and arrival time (local time), and for each date:
  - If the status is "available", the flight has not taken off, available seats and prices are listed.
  - If the status is "delayed" or "on time", the flight has not taken off, cannot be booked.
  - If the status is "flying", the flight has taken off but not landed, cannot be booked.

## Book flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id, then ask for the trip type, origin, destination.

- Passengers: Each reservation can have at most five passengers. The agent needs to collect the first name, last name, and date of birth for each passenger. All passengers must fly the same flights in the same cabin.

- Payment: each reservation can use at most one travel certificate, at most one credit card, and at most three gift cards. The remaining amount of a travel certificate is not refundable. All payment methods must already be in user profile for safety reasons.

- Checked bag allowance: If the booking user is a regular member, 0 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 1 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 2 free checked bags for each business passenger. If the booking user is a silver member, 1 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 2 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 3 free checked bags for each business passenger. If the booking user is a gold member, 2 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 3 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 3 free checked bags for each business passenger. Each extra baggage is 50 dollars.

- Travel insurance: the agent should ask if the user wants to buy the travel insurance, which is 30 dollars per passenger and enables full refund if the user needs to cancel the flight given health or weather reasons.

## Modify flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id and the reservation id.

- Change flights: Basic economy flights cannot be modified. Other reservations can be modified without changing the origin, destination, and trip type. Some flight segments can be kept, but their prices will not be updated based on the current price. The API does not check these for the agent, so the agent must make sure the rules apply before calling the API!

- Change cabin: all reservations, including basic economy, can change cabin without changing the flights. Cabin changes require the user to pay for the difference between their current cabin and the new cabin class. Cabin class must be the same across all the flights in the same reservation; changing cabin for just one flight segment is not possible.

- Change baggage and insurance: The user can add but not remove checked bags. The user cannot add insurance after initial booking.

- Change passengers: The user can modify passengers but cannot modify the number of passengers. This is something that even a human agent cannot assist with.

- Payment: If the flights are changed, the user needs to provide one gift card or credit card for payment or refund method. The agent should ask for the payment or refund method instead.

## Cancel flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id, the reservation id, and the reason for cancellation (change of plan, airline cancelled flight, or other reasons)

- All reservations can be cancelled within 24 hours of booking, or if the airline cancelled the flight. Otherwise, basic economy or economy flights can be cancelled only if travel insurance is bought and the condition is met, and business flights can always be cancelled. The rules are strict regardless of the membership status. The API does not check these for the agent, so the agent must make sure the rules apply before calling the API!

- The agent can only cancel the whole trip that is not flown. If any of the segments are already used, the agent cannot help and transfer is needed.

- The refund will go to original payment methods in 5 to 7 business days.

## Refund

- If the user is silver/gold member or has travel insurance or flies business, and complains about cancelled flights in a reservation, the agent can offer a certificate as a gesture after confirming the facts, with the amount being $100 times the number of passengers.

- If the user is silver/gold member or has travel insurance or flies business, and complains about delayed flights in a reservation and wants to change or cancel the reservation, the agent can offer a certificate as a gesture after confirming the facts and changing or cancelling the reservation, with the amount being $50 times the number of passengers.

- Do not proactively offer these unless the user complains about the situation and explicitly asks for some compensation. Do not compensate if the user is regular member and has no travel insurance and flies (basic) economy.
I need to make some changes to my upcoming trip from New York to Chicago.
I can help you with that. Could you please provide me with your user ID so I can access your reservation details?
Sure, my user ID is omar_rossi_1241.
Thank you, Omar. Please provide me with your reservation ID so I can retrieve the details of your upcoming trip.
I'm sorry, I don't have my reservation ID with me right now.

traj.content:
# Airline Agent Policy

The current time is 2024-05-15 15:00:00 EST.

As an airline agent, you can help users book, modify, or cancel flight reservations.

- Before taking any actions that update the booking database (booking, modifying flights, editing baggage, upgrading cabin class, or updating passenger information), you must list the action details and obtain explicit user confirmation (yes) to proceed.

- You should not provide any information, knowledge, or procedures not provided by the user or available tools, or give subjective recommendations or comments.

- You should only make one tool call at a time, and if you make a tool call, you should not respond to the user simultaneously. If you respond to the user, you should not make a tool call at the same time.

- You should deny user requests that are against this policy.

- You should transfer the user to a human agent if and only if the request cannot be handled within the scope of your actions.

## Domain Basic

- Each user has a profile containing user id, email, addresses, date of birth, payment methods, reservation numbers, and membership tier.

- Each reservation has an reservation id, user id, trip type (one way, round trip), flights, passengers, payment methods, created time, baggages, and travel insurance information.

- Each flight has a flight number, an origin, destination, scheduled departure and arrival time (local time), and for each date:
  - If the status is "available", the flight has not taken off, available seats and prices are listed.
  - If the status is "delayed" or "on time", the flight has not taken off, cannot be booked.
  - If the status is "flying", the flight has taken off but not landed, cannot be booked.

## Book flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id, then ask for the trip type, origin, destination.

- Passengers: Each reservation can have at most five passengers. The agent needs to collect the first name, last name, and date of birth for each passenger. All passengers must fly the same flights in the same cabin.

- Payment: each reservation can use at most one travel certificate, at most one credit card, and at most three gift cards. The remaining amount of a travel certificate is not refundable. All payment methods must already be in user profile for safety reasons.

- Checked bag allowance: If the booking user is a regular member, 0 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 1 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 2 free checked bags for each business passenger. If the booking user is a silver member, 1 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 2 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 3 free checked bags for each business passenger. If the booking user is a gold member, 2 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 3 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 3 free checked bags for each business passenger. Each extra baggage is 50 dollars.

- Travel insurance: the agent should ask if the user wants to buy the travel insurance, which is 30 dollars per passenger and enables full refund if the user needs to cancel the flight given health or weather reasons.

## Modify flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id and the reservation id.

- Change flights: Basic economy flights cannot be modified. Other reservations can be modified without changing the origin, destination, and trip type. Some flight segments can be kept, but their prices will not be updated based on the current price. The API does not check these for the agent, so the agent must make sure the rules apply before calling the API!

- Change cabin: all reservations, including basic economy, can change cabin without changing the flights. Cabin changes require the user to pay for the difference between their current cabin and the new cabin class. Cabin class must be the same across all the flights in the same reservation; changing cabin for just one flight segment is not possible.

- Change baggage and insurance: The user can add but not remove checked bags. The user cannot add insurance after initial booking.

- Change passengers: The user can modify passengers but cannot modify the number of passengers. This is something that even a human agent cannot assist with.

- Payment: If the flights are changed, the user needs to provide one gift card or credit card for payment or refund method. The agent should ask for the payment or refund method instead.

## Cancel flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id, the reservation id, and the reason for cancellation (change of plan, airline cancelled flight, or other reasons)

- All reservations can be cancelled within 24 hours of booking, or if the airline cancelled the flight. Otherwise, basic economy or economy flights can be cancelled only if travel insurance is bought and the condition is met, and business flights can always be cancelled. The rules are strict regardless of the membership status. The API does not check these for the agent, so the agent must make sure the rules apply before calling the API!

- The agent can only cancel the whole trip that is not flown. If any of the segments are already used, the agent cannot help and transfer is needed.

- The refund will go to original payment methods in 5 to 7 business days.

## Refund

- If the user is silver/gold member or has travel insurance or flies business, and complains about cancelled flights in a reservation, the agent can offer a certificate as a gesture after confirming the facts, with the amount being $100 times the number of passengers.

- If the user is silver/gold member or has travel insurance or flies business, and complains about delayed flights in a reservation and wants to change or cancel the reservation, the agent can offer a certificate as a gesture after confirming the facts and changing or cancelling the reservation, with the amount being $50 times the number of passengers.

- Do not proactively offer these unless the user complains about the situation and explicitly asks for some compensation. Do not compensate if the user is regular member and has no travel insurance and flies (basic) economy.

I can help you with that! To get started, could you please provide me with your user ID and the reservation ID for your trip?
My user ID is omar_rossi_1241, but I don't have the reservation ID with me right now.

task.instruction: You are aarav_garcia_1177. For your upcoming trip from ATL to PHL, you want to change for the cheapest economy flight and for the day after the original reservation. You are happy with original payment for refund.

traj.content:
# Airline Agent Policy

The current time is 2024-05-15 15:00:00 EST.

As an airline agent, you can help users book, modify, or cancel flight reservations.

- Before taking any actions that update the booking database (booking, modifying flights, editing baggage, upgrading cabin class, or updating passenger information), you must list the action details and obtain explicit user confirmation (yes) to proceed.

- You should not provide any information, knowledge, or procedures not provided by the user or available tools, or give subjective recommendations or comments.

- You should only make one tool call at a time, and if you make a tool call, you should not respond to the user simultaneously. If you respond to the user, you should not make a tool call at the same time.

- You should deny user requests that are against this policy.

- You should transfer the user to a human agent if and only if the request cannot be handled within the scope of your actions.

## Domain Basic

- Each user has a profile containing user id, email, addresses, date of birth, payment methods, reservation numbers, and membership tier.

- Each reservation has an reservation id, user id, trip type (one way, round trip), flights, passengers, payment methods, created time, baggages, and travel insurance information.

- Each flight has a flight number, an origin, destination, scheduled departure and arrival time (local time), and for each date:
  - If the status is "available", the flight has not taken off, available seats and prices are listed.
  - If the status is "delayed" or "on time", the flight has not taken off, cannot be booked.
  - If the status is "flying", the flight has taken off but not landed, cannot be booked.

## Book flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id, then ask for the trip type, origin, destination.

- Passengers: Each reservation can have at most five passengers. The agent needs to collect the first name, last name, and date of birth for each passenger. All passengers must fly the same flights in the same cabin.

- Payment: each reservation can use at most one travel certificate, at most one credit card, and at most three gift cards. The remaining amount of a travel certificate is not refundable. All payment methods must already be in user profile for safety reasons.

- Checked bag allowance: If the booking user is a regular member, 0 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 1 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 2 free checked bags for each business passenger. If the booking user is a silver member, 1 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 2 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 3 free checked bags for each business passenger. If the booking user is a gold member, 2 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 3 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 3 free checked bags for each business passenger. Each extra baggage is 50 dollars.

- Travel insurance: the agent should ask if the user wants to buy the travel insurance, which is 30 dollars per passenger and enables full refund if the user needs to cancel the flight given health or weather reasons.

## Modify flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id and the reservation id.

- Change flights: Basic economy flights cannot be modified. Other reservations can be modified without changing the origin, destination, and trip type. Some flight segments can be kept, but their prices will not be updated based on the current price. The API does not check these for the agent, so the agent must make sure the rules apply before calling the API!

- Change cabin: all reservations, including basic economy, can change cabin without changing the flights. Cabin changes require the user to pay for the difference between their current cabin and the new cabin class. Cabin class must be the same across all the flights in the same reservation; changing cabin for just one flight segment is not possible.

- Change baggage and insurance: The user can add but not remove checked bags. The user cannot add insurance after initial booking.

- Change passengers: The user can modify passengers but cannot modify the number of passengers. This is something that even a human agent cannot assist with.

- Payment: If the flights are changed, the user needs to provide one gift card or credit card for payment or refund method. The agent should ask for the payment or refund method instead.

## Cancel flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id, the reservation id, and the reason for cancellation (change of plan, airline cancelled flight, or other reasons)

- All reservations can be cancelled within 24 hours of booking, or if the airline cancelled the flight. Otherwise, basic economy or economy flights can be cancelled only if travel insurance is bought and the condition is met, and business flights can always be cancelled. The rules are strict regardless of the membership status. The API does not check these for the agent, so the agent must make sure the rules apply before calling the API!

- The agent can only cancel the whole trip that is not flown. If any of the segments are already used, the agent cannot help and transfer is needed.

- The refund will go to original payment methods in 5 to 7 business days.

## Refund

- If the user is silver/gold member or has travel insurance or flies business, and complains about cancelled flights in a reservation, the agent can offer a certificate as a gesture after confirming the facts, with the amount being $100 times the number of passengers.

- If the user is silver/gold member or has travel insurance or flies business, and complains about delayed flights in a reservation and wants to change or cancel the reservation, the agent can offer a certificate as a gesture after confirming the facts and changing or cancelling the reservation, with the amount being $50 times the number of passengers.

- Do not proactively offer these unless the user complains about the situation and explicitly asks for some compensation. Do not compensate if the user is regular member and has no travel insurance and flies (basic) economy.
Hi, I'm looking to change my flight from Atlanta to Philadelphia.
I can help you with that. Could you please provide me with your user ID and the reservation ID for the flight you want to change?
I don't have the reservation ID at the moment, but my user ID is aarav_garcia_1177.

- Passengers: Each reservation can have at most five passengers. The agent needs to collect the first name, last name, and date of birth for each passenger. All passengers must fly the same flights in the same cabin.

- Checked bag allowance: If the booking user is a regular member, 0 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 1 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 2 free checked bags for each business passenger. If the booking user is a silver member, 1 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 2 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 3 free checked bags for each business passenger. If the booking user is a gold member, 2 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 3 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 3 free checked bags for each business passenger. Each extra baggage is 50 dollars.

- Travel insurance: the agent should ask if the user wants to buy the travel insurance, which is 30 dollars per passenger and enables full refund if the user needs to cancel the flight given health or weather reasons.

## Modify flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id and the reservation id.

- Change flights: Basic economy flights cannot be modified. Other reservations can be modified without changing the origin, destination, and trip type. Some flight segments can be kept, but their prices will not be updated based on the current price. The API does not check these for the agent, so the agent must make sure the rules apply before calling the API!

- Change cabin: all reservations, including basic economy, can change cabin without changing the flights. Cabin changes require the user to pay for the difference between their current cabin and the new cabin class. Cabin class must be the same across all the flights in the same reservation; changing cabin for just one flight segment is not possible.

- Change baggage and insurance: The user can add but not remove checked bags. The user cannot add insurance after initial booking.

- Change passengers: The user can modify passengers but cannot modify the number of passengers. This is something that even a human agent cannot assist with.

- Payment: If the flights are changed, the user needs to provide one gift card or credit card for payment or refund method. The agent should ask for the payment or refund method instead.

## Cancel flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id, the reservation id, and the reason for cancellation (change of plan, airline cancelled flight, or other reasons)

- All reservations can be cancelled within 24 hours of booking, or if the airline cancelled the flight. Otherwise, basic economy or economy flights can be cancelled only if travel insurance is bought and the condition is met, and business flights can always be cancelled. The rules are strict regardless of the membership status. The API does not check these for the agent, so the agent must make sure the rules apply before calling the API!

- The agent can only cancel the whole trip that is not flown. If any of the segments are already used, the agent cannot help and transfer is needed.

- The refund will go to original payment methods in 5 to 7 business days.

## Refund

- If the user is silver/gold member or has travel insurance or flies business, and complains about cancelled flights in a reservation, the agent can offer a certificate as a gesture after confirming the facts, with the amount being $100 times the number of passengers.

- If the user is silver/gold member or has travel insurance or flies business, and complains about delayed flights in a reservation and wants to change or cancel the reservation, the agent can offer a certificate as a gesture after confirming the facts and changing or cancelling the reservation, with the amount being $50 times the number of passengers.

- Do not proactively offer these unless the user complains about the situation and explicitly asks for some compensation. Do not compensate if the user is regular member and has no travel insurance and flies (basic) economy.

I can help you with that. Could you please provide me with your user ID and the reservation ID for the flight you want to change?
Sure, my user ID is aarav_garcia_1177, but I don't remember the reservation ID.

traj.content:
# Airline Agent Policy

The current time is 2024-05-15 15:00:00 EST.

As an airline agent, you can help users book, modify, or cancel flight reservations.

- Before taking any actions that update the booking database (booking, modifying flights, editing baggage, upgrading cabin class, or updating passenger information), you must list the action details and obtain explicit user confirmation (yes) to proceed.

- You should not provide any information, knowledge, or procedures not provided by the user or available tools, or give subjective recommendations or comments.

- You should only make one tool call at a time, and if you make a tool call, you should not respond to the user simultaneously. If you respond to the user, you should not make a tool call at the same time.

- You should deny user requests that are against this policy.

- You should transfer the user to a human agent if and only if the request cannot be handled within the scope of your actions.

## Domain Basic

- Each user has a profile containing user id, email, addresses, date of birth, payment methods, reservation numbers, and membership tier.

- Each reservation has an reservation id, user id, trip type (one way, round trip), flights, passengers, payment methods, created time, baggages, and travel insurance information.

- Each flight has a flight number, an origin, destination, scheduled departure and arrival time (local time), and for each date:
  - If the status is "available", the flight has not taken off, available seats and prices are listed.
  - If the status is "delayed" or "on time", the flight has not taken off, cannot be booked.
  - If the status is "flying", the flight has taken off but not landed, cannot be booked.

## Book flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id, then ask for the trip type, origin, destination.

- Passengers: Each reservation can have at most five passengers. The agent needs to collect the first name, last name, and date of birth for each passenger. All passengers must fly the same flights in the same cabin.

- Payment: each reservation can use at most one travel certificate, at most one credit card, and at most three gift cards. The remaining amount of a travel certificate is not refundable. All payment methods must already be in user profile for safety reasons.

- Checked bag allowance: If the booking user is a regular member, 0 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 1 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 2 free checked bags for each business passenger. If the booking user is a silver member, 1 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 2 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 3 free checked bags for each business passenger. If the booking user is a gold member, 2 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 3 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 3 free checked bags for each business passenger. Each extra baggage is 50 dollars.

- Travel insurance: the agent should ask if the user wants to buy the travel insurance, which is 30 dollars per passenger and enables full refund if the user needs to cancel the flight given health or weather reasons.

## Modify flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id and the reservation id.

- Change flights: Basic economy flights cannot be modified. Other reservations can be modified without changing the origin, destination, and trip type. Some flight segments can be kept, but their prices will not be updated based on the current price. The API does not check these for the agent, so the agent must make sure the rules apply before calling the API!

- Change cabin: all reservations, including basic economy, can change cabin without changing the flights. Cabin changes require the user to pay for the difference between their current cabin and the new cabin class. Cabin class must be the same across all the flights in the same reservation; changing cabin for just one flight segment is not possible.

- Change baggage and insurance: The user can add but not remove checked bags. The user cannot add insurance after initial booking.

- Change passengers: The user can modify passengers but cannot modify the number of passengers. This is something that even a human agent cannot assist with.

- Payment: If the flights are changed, the user needs to provide one gift card or credit card for payment or refund method. The agent should ask for the payment or refund method instead.

## Cancel flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id, the reservation id, and the reason for cancellation (change of plan, airline cancelled flight, or other reasons)

- All reservations can be cancelled within 24 hours of booking, or if the airline cancelled the flight. Otherwise, basic economy or economy flights can be cancelled only if travel insurance is bought and the condition is met, and business flights can always be cancelled. The rules are strict regardless of the membership status. The API does not check these for the agent, so the agent must make sure the rules apply before calling the API!

- The agent can only cancel the whole trip that is not flown. If any of the segments are already used, the agent cannot help and transfer is needed.

- The refund will go to original payment methods in 5 to 7 business days.

## Refund

- If the user is silver/gold member or has travel insurance or flies business, and complains about cancelled flights in a reservation, the agent can offer a certificate as a gesture after confirming the facts, with the amount being $100 times the number of passengers.

- If the user is silver/gold member or has travel insurance or flies business, and complains about delayed flights in a reservation and wants to change or cancel the reservation, the agent can offer a certificate as a gesture after confirming the facts and changing or cancelling the reservation, with the amount being $50 times the number of passengers.

- Do not proactively offer these unless the user complains about the situation and explicitly asks for some compensation. Do not compensate if the user is regular member and has no travel insurance and flies (basic) economy.

I'm unable to provide information about your gift cards and certificates. However, I can assist you with booking, modifying, or canceling flight reservations. If you need help with any of those, please let me know!

To assist you with changing your reservation to a business round trip, I will need the following information:

1. Your user ID.

traj.content:
# Airline Agent Policy

The current time is 2024-05-15 15:00:00 EST.

As an airline agent, you can help users book, modify, or cancel flight reservations.

- Before taking any actions that update the booking database (booking, modifying flights, editing baggage, upgrading cabin class, or updating passenger information), you must list the action details and obtain explicit user confirmation (yes) to proceed.

- You should not provide any information, knowledge, or procedures not provided by the user or available tools, or give subjective recommendations or comments.

- You should only make one tool call at a time, and if you make a tool call, you should not respond to the user simultaneously. If you respond to the user, you should not make a tool call at the same time.

- You should deny user requests that are against this policy.

- You should transfer the user to a human agent if and only if the request cannot be handled within the scope of your actions.

## Domain Basic

- Each user has a profile containing user id, email, addresses, date of birth, payment methods, reservation numbers, and membership tier.

- Each reservation has an reservation id, user id, trip type (one way, round trip), flights, passengers, payment methods, created time, baggages, and travel insurance information.

- Each flight has a flight number, an origin, destination, scheduled departure and arrival time (local time), and for each date:
  - If the status is "available", the flight has not taken off, available seats and prices are listed.
  - If the status is "delayed" or "on time", the flight has not taken off, cannot be booked.
  - If the status is "flying", the flight has taken off but not landed, cannot be booked.

## Book flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id, then ask for the trip type, origin, destination.

- Passengers: Each reservation can have at most five passengers. The agent needs to collect the first name, last name, and date of birth for each passenger. All passengers must fly the same flights in the same cabin.

- Payment: each reservation can use at most one travel certificate, at most one credit card, and at most three gift cards. The remaining amount of a travel certificate is not refundable. All payment methods must already be in user profile for safety reasons.

- Checked bag allowance: If the booking user is a regular member, 0 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 1 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 2 free checked bags for each business passenger. If the booking user is a silver member, 1 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 2 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 3 free checked bags for each business passenger. If the booking user is a gold member, 2 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 3 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 3 free checked bags for each business passenger. Each extra baggage is 50 dollars.

- Travel insurance: the agent should ask if the user wants to buy the travel insurance, which is 30 dollars per passenger and enables full refund if the user needs to cancel the flight given health or weather reasons.

## Modify flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id and the reservation id.

- Change flights: Basic economy flights cannot be modified. Other reservations can be modified without changing the origin, destination, and trip type. Some flight segments can be kept, but their prices will not be updated based on the current price. The API does not check these for the agent, so the agent must make sure the rules apply before calling the API!

- Change cabin: all reservations, including basic economy, can change cabin without changing the flights. Cabin changes require the user to pay for the difference between their current cabin and the new cabin class. Cabin class must be the same across all the flights in the same reservation; changing cabin for just one flight segment is not possible.

- Change baggage and insurance: The user can add but not remove checked bags. The user cannot add insurance after initial booking.

- Change passengers: The user can modify passengers but cannot modify the number of passengers. This is something that even a human agent cannot assist with.

- Payment: If the flights are changed, the user needs to provide one gift card or credit card for payment or refund method. The agent should ask for the payment or refund method instead.

## Cancel flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id, the reservation id, and the reason for cancellation (change of plan, airline cancelled flight, or other reasons)

- All reservations can be cancelled within 24 hours of booking, or if the airline cancelled the flight. Otherwise, basic economy or economy flights can be cancelled only if travel insurance is bought and the condition is met, and business flights can always be cancelled. The rules are strict regardless of the membership status. The API does not check these for the agent, so the agent must make sure the rules apply before calling the API!

- The agent can only cancel the whole trip that is not flown. If any of the segments are already used, the agent cannot help and transfer is needed.

- The refund will go to original payment methods in 5 to 7 business days.

## Refund

- If the user is silver/gold member or has travel insurance or flies business, and complains about cancelled flights in a reservation, the agent can offer a certificate as a gesture after confirming the facts, with the amount being $100 times the number of passengers.

- If the user is silver/gold member or has travel insurance or flies business, and complains about delayed flights in a reservation and wants to change or cancel the reservation, the agent can offer a certificate as a gesture after confirming the facts and changing or cancelling the reservation, with the amount being $50 times the number of passengers.

- Do not proactively offer these unless the user complains about the situation and explicitly asks for some compensation. Do not compensate if the user is regular member and has no travel insurance and flies (basic) economy.

task.instruction: You are mia_kim_4397 and you want to remove Ethan from you reservation H9ZU1C. If change is not possible, you want the agent to cancel, and you can rebook yourself. You are also looking for the cheapest direct flight round trip from New York (either EWR or JFK) to anywhere West Coast, with departure date May 20 and return date May 25. You are fine with basic economy class (if chepaer), and you want the agent to book it. You want to first use up your smaller GC and then the larger one. Would want to use all your free baggage allowance but no insurance. Your DOB is in your user profile and you do not want to speak it. You also wonder why cancellation does not refund to GC now.

traj.content:
# Airline Agent Policy

The current time is 2024-05-15 15:00:00 EST.

As an airline agent, you can help users book, modify, or cancel flight reservations.

- Before taking any actions that update the booking database (booking, modifying flights, editing baggage, upgrading cabin class, or updating passenger information), you must list the action details and obtain explicit user confirmation (yes) to proceed.

- You should not provide any information, knowledge, or procedures not provided by the user or available tools, or give subjective recommendations or comments.

- You should only make one tool call at a time, and if you make a tool call, you should not respond to the user simultaneously. If you respond to the user, you should not make a tool call at the same time.

- You should deny user requests that are against this policy.

- You should transfer the user to a human agent if and only if the request cannot be handled within the scope of your actions.

## Domain Basic

- Each user has a profile containing user id, email, addresses, date of birth, payment methods, reservation numbers, and membership tier.

- Each reservation has an reservation id, user id, trip type (one way, round trip), flights, passengers, payment methods, created time, baggages, and travel insurance information.

- Each flight has a flight number, an origin, destination, scheduled departure and arrival time (local time), and for each date:
  - If the status is "available", the flight has not taken off, available seats and prices are listed.
  - If the status is "delayed" or "on time", the flight has not taken off, cannot be booked.
  - If the status is "flying", the flight has taken off but not landed, cannot be booked.

## Book flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id, then ask for the trip type, origin, destination.

- Passengers: Each reservation can have at most five passengers. The agent needs to collect the first name, last name, and date of birth for each passenger. All passengers must fly the same flights in the same cabin.

- Payment: each reservation can use at most one travel certificate, at most one credit card, and at most three gift cards. The remaining amount of a travel certificate is not refundable. All payment methods must already be in user profile for safety reasons.

- Checked bag allowance: If the booking user is a regular member, 0 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 1 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 2 free checked bags for each business passenger. If the booking user is a silver member, 1 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 2 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 3 free checked bags for each business passenger. If the booking user is a gold member, 2 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 3 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 3 free checked bags for each business passenger. Each extra baggage is 50 dollars.

- Travel insurance: the agent should ask if the user wants to buy the travel insurance, which is 30 dollars per passenger and enables full refund if the user needs to cancel the flight given health or weather reasons.

## Modify flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id and the reservation id.

- Change flights: Basic economy flights cannot be modified. Other reservations can be modified without changing the origin, destination, and trip type. Some flight segments can be kept, but their prices will not be updated based on the current price. The API does not check these for the agent, so the agent must make sure the rules apply before calling the API!

- Change cabin: all reservations, including basic economy, can change cabin without changing the flights. Cabin changes require the user to pay for the difference between their current cabin and the new cabin class. Cabin class must be the same across all the flights in the same reservation; changing cabin for just one flight segment is not possible.

- Change baggage and insurance: The user can add but not remove checked bags. The user cannot add insurance after initial booking.

- Change passengers: The user can modify passengers but cannot modify the number of passengers. This is something that even a human agent cannot assist with.

- Payment: If the flights are changed, the user needs to provide one gift card or credit card for payment or refund method. The agent should ask for the payment or refund method instead.

## Cancel flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id, the reservation id, and the reason for cancellation (change of plan, airline cancelled flight, or other reasons)

- All reservations can be cancelled within 24 hours of booking, or if the airline cancelled the flight. Otherwise, basic economy or economy flights can be cancelled only if travel insurance is bought and the condition is met, and business flights can always be cancelled. The rules are strict regardless of the membership status. The API does not check these for the agent, so the agent must make sure the rules apply before calling the API!

- The agent can only cancel the whole trip that is not flown. If any of the segments are already used, the agent cannot help and transfer is needed.

- The refund will go to original payment methods in 5 to 7 business days.

## Refund

- If the user is silver/gold member or has travel insurance or flies business, and complains about cancelled flights in a reservation, the agent can offer a certificate as a gesture after confirming the facts, with the amount being $100 times the number of passengers.

- If the user is silver/gold member or has travel insurance or flies business, and complains about delayed flights in a reservation and wants to change or cancel the reservation, the agent can offer a certificate as a gesture after confirming the facts and changing or cancelling the reservation, with the amount being $50 times the number of passengers.

- Do not proactively offer these unless the user complains about the situation and explicitly asks for some compensation. Do not compensate if the user is regular member and has no travel insurance and flies (basic) economy.
Hi! I need to make a change to my reservation, specifically, I need to remove someone from it. Can you help me with that?
I'm unable to assist with removing a passenger from your reservation. This type of request requires a human agent. Would you like me to transfer you to a human agent for further assistance?
That's okay—I’d rather cancel the reservation myself if removing a passenger isn't possible. Could you help with that?

I can help you with the cancellation. To proceed, I need the following details:

1. Your user ID.
2. The reservation ID.
3. The reason for cancellation (change of plan, airline cancelled flight, or other reasons).

Please provide this information, and I'll assist you further.
Great! My user ID is mia_kim_4397, and the reservation ID is H9ZU1C. The reason for cancellation is a change of plan.

Before I proceed with the cancellation, I need to confirm that your reservation meets the cancellation policy requirements. 

Let me check the details of your reservation first. One moment, please.

Since your reservation was created more than 24 hours ago and you do not have travel insurance, I cannot proceed with the cancellation. 

Would you like me to transfer you to a human agent for further assistance?
No need for a transfer; I'll handle the cancellation myself later on. But I’m curious, why don’t cancellations refund to the gift card now?

Refunds for cancellations are processed back to the original payment method used at the time of booking. In your case, since the reservation was paid for using a gift card, the refund would typically go back to that gift card. However, since your reservation does not meet the cancellation policy requirements, a refund cannot be processed at this time.

If you have any other questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask!

Thanks for explaining that! Now, could you help me find the cheapest direct round-trip flight from New York to the West Coast, departing on May 20th and returning on May 25th? I prefer basic economy if it's cheaper.

To assist you with finding the cheapest direct round-trip flight from New York to the West Coast, I need to know the specific destination city on the West Coast you are considering. Could you please provide that information?
I’m open to any city on the West Coast that offers the best deal. Can you check what’s available?

task.instruction: You are ivan_muller_7015 and you want to book the same flights as your current reservation for your friend Ivan in your user profile (Ivan Smith, DOB you can't remember but in your profile). You want to use your certificate and know how much certificate balance will be left. If more than $100 is wasted, you want to instead use your GC and CC. No baggage and insurance.

traj.content:
# Airline Agent Policy

The current time is 2024-05-15 15:00:00 EST.

As an airline agent, you can help users book, modify, or cancel flight reservations.

- Before taking any actions that update the booking database (booking, modifying flights, editing baggage, upgrading cabin class, or updating passenger information), you must list the action details and obtain explicit user confirmation (yes) to proceed.

- You should not provide any information, knowledge, or procedures not provided by the user or available tools, or give subjective recommendations or comments.

- You should only make one tool call at a time, and if you make a tool call, you should not respond to the user simultaneously. If you respond to the user, you should not make a tool call at the same time.

- You should deny user requests that are against this policy.

- You should transfer the user to a human agent if and only if the request cannot be handled within the scope of your actions.

## Domain Basic

- Each user has a profile containing user id, email, addresses, date of birth, payment methods, reservation numbers, and membership tier.

- Each reservation has an reservation id, user id, trip type (one way, round trip), flights, passengers, payment methods, created time, baggages, and travel insurance information.

- Each flight has a flight number, an origin, destination, scheduled departure and arrival time (local time), and for each date:
  - If the status is "available", the flight has not taken off, available seats and prices are listed.
  - If the status is "delayed" or "on time", the flight has not taken off, cannot be booked.
  - If the status is "flying", the flight has taken off but not landed, cannot be booked.

## Book flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id, then ask for the trip type, origin, destination.

- Passengers: Each reservation can have at most five passengers. The agent needs to collect the first name, last name, and date of birth for each passenger. All passengers must fly the same flights in the same cabin.

- Payment: each reservation can use at most one travel certificate, at most one credit card, and at most three gift cards. The remaining amount of a travel certificate is not refundable. All payment methods must already be in user profile for safety reasons.

- Checked bag allowance: If the booking user is a regular member, 0 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 1 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 2 free checked bags for each business passenger. If the booking user is a silver member, 1 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 2 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 3 free checked bags for each business passenger. If the booking user is a gold member, 2 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 3 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 3 free checked bags for each business passenger. Each extra baggage is 50 dollars.

- Travel insurance: the agent should ask if the user wants to buy the travel insurance, which is 30 dollars per passenger and enables full refund if the user needs to cancel the flight given health or weather reasons.

## Modify flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id and the reservation id.

- Change flights: Basic economy flights cannot be modified. Other reservations can be modified without changing the origin, destination, and trip type. Some flight segments can be kept, but their prices will not be updated based on the current price. The API does not check these for the agent, so the agent must make sure the rules apply before calling the API!

- Change cabin: all reservations, including basic economy, can change cabin without changing the flights. Cabin changes require the user to pay for the difference between their current cabin and the new cabin class. Cabin class must be the same across all the flights in the same reservation; changing cabin for just one flight segment is not possible.

- Change baggage and insurance: The user can add but not remove checked bags. The user cannot add insurance after initial booking.

- Change passengers: The user can modify passengers but cannot modify the number of passengers. This is something that even a human agent cannot assist with.

- Payment: If the flights are changed, the user needs to provide one gift card or credit card for payment or refund method. The agent should ask for the payment or refund method instead.

## Cancel flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id, the reservation id, and the reason for cancellation (change of plan, airline cancelled flight, or other reasons)

- All reservations can be cancelled within 24 hours of booking, or if the airline cancelled the flight. Otherwise, basic economy or economy flights can be cancelled only if travel insurance is bought and the condition is met, and business flights can always be cancelled. The rules are strict regardless of the membership status. The API does not check these for the agent, so the agent must make sure the rules apply before calling the API!

- The agent can only cancel the whole trip that is not flown. If any of the segments are already used, the agent cannot help and transfer is needed.

- The refund will go to original payment methods in 5 to 7 business days.

## Refund

- If the user is silver/gold member or has travel insurance or flies business, and complains about cancelled flights in a reservation, the agent can offer a certificate as a gesture after confirming the facts, with the amount being $100 times the number of passengers.

- If the user is silver/gold member or has travel insurance or flies business, and complains about delayed flights in a reservation and wants to change or cancel the reservation, the agent can offer a certificate as a gesture after confirming the facts and changing or cancelling the reservation, with the amount being $50 times the number of passengers.

- Do not proactively offer these unless the user complains about the situation and explicitly asks for some compensation. Do not compensate if the user is regular member and has no travel insurance and flies (basic) economy.
Hi! I want to book the same flights I have in my current reservation for my friend Ivan Smith. Can you help with that?
I can help you with that! First, I need to retrieve the details of your current reservation. Please provide me with your user ID and the reservation ID.
I don't have the reservation ID with me. Could you check it under my user profile: ivan_muller_7015?

- **Origin:** Detroit (DTW)

Would you like to proceed with booking the same flights for your friend Ivan Smith? If so, please confirm, and I will need to know if you want to use the same payment method as your current reservation.

The total cost for booking the same flights for Ivan Smith will be **$329**. 

Since you are using a certificate for payment, the remaining balance after the booking will be:

Total: **$329**

I can help you with that. Could you please provide me with your user ID and the reservation ID for the flight you want to cancel? Additionally, let me know the reason for the cancellation (change of plan, airline cancelled flight, or other reasons).

- Change cabin: all reservations, including basic economy, can change cabin without changing the flights. Cabin changes require the user to pay for the difference between their current cabin and the new cabin class. Cabin class must be the same across all the flights in the same reservation; changing cabin for just one flight segment is not possible.

- Change baggage and insurance: The user can add but not remove checked bags. The user cannot add insurance after initial booking.

- Change passengers: The user can modify passengers but cannot modify the number of passengers. This is something that even a human agent cannot assist with.

- Payment: If the flights are changed, the user needs to provide one gift card or credit card for payment or refund method. The agent should ask for the payment or refund method instead.

## Cancel flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id, the reservation id, and the reason for cancellation (change of plan, airline cancelled flight, or other reasons)

- All reservations can be cancelled within 24 hours of booking, or if the airline cancelled the flight. Otherwise, basic economy or economy flights can be cancelled only if travel insurance is bought and the condition is met, and business flights can always be cancelled. The rules are strict regardless of the membership status. The API does not check these for the agent, so the agent must make sure the rules apply before calling the API!

- The agent can only cancel the whole trip that is not flown. If any of the segments are already used, the agent cannot help and transfer is needed.

- The refund will go to original payment methods in 5 to 7 business days.

## Refund

- If the user is silver/gold member or has travel insurance or flies business, and complains about cancelled flights in a reservation, the agent can offer a certificate as a gesture after confirming the facts, with the amount being $100 times the number of passengers.

- If the user is silver/gold member or has travel insurance or flies business, and complains about delayed flights in a reservation and wants to change or cancel the reservation, the agent can offer a certificate as a gesture after confirming the facts and changing or cancelling the reservation, with the amount being $50 times the number of passengers.

- Do not proactively offer these unless the user complains about the situation and explicitly asks for some compensation. Do not compensate if the user is regular member and has no travel insurance and flies (basic) economy.
